blendingOne: Forms a single transaction from multiple parties by merging similar inputs and outputs, and relaying these operations in an encrypted manner between the participants.
blendingTwo: The middleman is reduced to a blind relay and the participants are unable to reconstruct the original inputs from the blended transaction.
blendingThree: This makes for a truly untraceable system offering a high degree of anonymity without counter-party risk.
descOne: Vcash shares the same basic network and cryptographic principles as Bitcoin.
descTwo: The code is written in a backwards compatible but modern approach using C++11.
descThree: It was built over a period of several years using Peercoin's Proof-of-Stake and Bitcoin's Proof-of-Work consensus as a reference implementation, bringing an alternative codebase to the cryptocurrency ecosystem.
engineeredFor: Engineered to have breakthrough performance and long-term stability.
incentiveOne: To ensure the network remains robust, the incentive reward voting system was enabled on block #220000.
incentiveTwo: Part of the coinbase reward is spread to a series of winning nodes that are performing network services.
networkLayers: Fully encrypted 3-tier network with UDP layer
networkLayersOne: All communications pathways are encrypted using strong algorithms, preventing anyone from deciphering the contents.
networkLayersTwo: The UDP layer is used to scale the realtime properties of the network, while significantly decreasing the network latency and easing the load on TCP channels.
networkLayersThree: 0.7% interest via Proof-of-Stake is used to secure the network and recoup destroyed transaction fees.
networkLayersFour: The chosen percentage along with the destruction of transaction fees makes for long term low inflation, which will reach a 1% annual inflation rate in 2019.
newsletter: Keep in touch with Vcash newsletter
noResults: There are no mentions of the provided keywords.
zerotimeOne: ZeroTime allows a recipient to immediately own and spend the received coins.
zerotimeTwo: Furthermore, they may be re-spent many times between other recipients before being consolidated on the ledger.
